Iâ€™m now looking for a co-founder, someone with vision, grit, and the hunger to build something from zero. Not just to join a venture, but to shape it. If that sounds like you, Iâ€™d love to talk.
fields.status: Yes, I am available full time.
fields.track_record_proud:
Co-founded a fintech startup (Roster), raising â‚¬100K in pre-seed funding, leading a 7-member team.
Scouted and supported over 20,000 startups for corporate partners across multiple tech verticals.
Tripled lead generation in 6 months through fractional C-level roles, driving GTM execution and cross-border expansion in Europe.
Led strategic partnerships and commercial growth, managing 30+ sponsors and 100+ speakers at a tech summit.
fields.interested_in_working_on:
Problem I'm currently working on solving: Young borrowers under 30 face systematic barriers within European credit scoring systems that stem from the fundamental design of traditional risk assessment methodologies. The emphasis on historical credit performance and established financial relationships inherently disadvantages individuals who have had limited time to develop comprehensive credit histories or accumulate substantial assets that serve as collateral or demonstrate financial stability.

With major players such as Schufa Holding AG, Experian, and other commercial listed companies controlling significant portions of European credit information systems, young borrowers who have primarily engaged with alternative financial services or maintained minimal traditional banking relationships may find their creditworthiness inadequately represented in standard assessment processes.

Solution: Behavioral credit scoring represents a paradigm shift in financial risk assessment, leveraging non-traditional data sources to evaluate creditworthiness. This approach analyzes patterns in digital transactions, social media interactions, mobile usage, and other behavioral indicators to complement or replace traditional metrics like payment history and debt-to-income ratios. In Europe, where 22% of adults lack access to traditional credit products, behavioral scoring offers potential solutions for financial inclusion while introducing complex regulatory considerations under evolving EU frameworks.

fields.interested_in_working_on:
What drives me to start a new venture comes down to three key factors: (1) working on a product or service I truly believe in, (2) targeting a large and scalable market opportunity, and (3) building alongside a co-founder and team that inspire me.

With that mindset, Iâ€™m now launching an ambitious deep tech venture in the humanoid robotics space. I believe strongly in the â€œbrownfieldâ€ conceptâ€”where human-form robots, powered by advanced AI, can integrate into existing environments and have a transformative impact. As a platform technology, humanoid robotics presents vast entrepreneurial potential. It can play a critical role in re-industrializing Europe and addressing structural challenges such as labor shortages in aging societies, as well as strengthening defense and technological sovereignty.

The timing is right for a generational opportunity: to build foundational infrastructure for the futureâ€”rooted in Europe, serving the world.

My journey started early: I wrote my first lines of C++ at 8, and by 11, I was interning at my first startup â€” debugging, shipping, and falling in love with building. That love never left.

Over the years, Iâ€™ve built and scaled products and tech teams from scratch, wearing every startup hat â€” from writing backend code to pitching investors. Iâ€™m a technical founder at heart, with deep expertise in distributed systems and high-throughput platforms. I can code 0 to 1, and scale processes and teams from 1 to 100.

I believe in fast iterations, staying uncomfortable, and surrounding myself with people who raise the bar.

PS:
While I have led and can do web app development, understand and build mobile apps - my current strengths are in building data platforms, web services (backend), infra setup and automation, designing scalable architectures and multiple clouds.

I like to see myself as a tech "couteau-suisse".  I've built my experience to draw a thin line between deep tech knowledge and the ability to translate business into requirements. 

At 15, I've built my first company : an e-sport team with a community agency. (That's where the "Counter-strike competitor" comes from).

During my studies, I've became president of the Junior-Entreprise (consulting association) of my engineering school, and then became CTO of the french confederation of Junior-Entreprise. (20k end users, 100k budget, and I've been multiple time speaker in front of >1.5 people). 

Worked at the most important energy company of the country. Horrible experience, but learned quite a bit. 

Then joined Sparkmate, a start-up studio that aims to ship company in 5 weeks, whatever the subject. Worked on an AI-powered ERP for top insurance company, a children story telling box powered by AI (start-up raised > 10M), a bus that recharges while moving, fencing shoes.  

Then I became sick. 

Recovered, then left the company. Built my own one. Failed it. (hopefully, what an experience it was!). Now, ready.

fields.introduction:
I am a recent PhD graduate in  in Computer Science from the University of Paris-Saclay with a strong background in AI/ML and NLP. I spent my last 3 years on developping an innovative solution for information extraction from news texts.

One of my key achievements was developing an ML model that matches the quality of existing solutions while being 500 times smaller and 20 times faster. 

I'm excited about the potential for ML and AI to transform the entire industries. I believe my combination of technical expertise and entrepreneurial mindset will help me to build something valuable and scalable. However, I recognize that to truly make a meaningful impact, then I need a co-founder with strong business acumen.
